## Syllabus
### Course Info
- E-mail: yyounmo@snu.ac.kr
- Office: #38-402
- Phone: 02-880-2269

- TA: Sungmin Ko (sungmine03@snu.ac.kr)

### Course Description
This course is aiming at introducing students to statistical methods and their applications in technology
management, economics and policy. It is primary intended to provide basic statistical inference for
econometrics and other quantitative analysis in business and economics. Specifically, in this class you will
become familiar with how to use and interpret basic descriptive statistics, probability distributions
estimation, forecasting, and regression analysis.

### Textbooks
- DeGroot, M.H. and M.J. Schervish, 2010, Probability and Statistics, 4th Edition, Addison-Wesley.

### Grading Policy:
All homework, quiz, and exams count toward the final grade. Your course grade will be calculated as,

- midterm 30%, 
- final exam 40%, 
- homework 20%
- others including attendance 10%

Exams are not open book, but a student is allowed to use one page (A4 size, one-side only, handwritten) of
notes during the exam.

### Homework
HW should be turned in before the beginning of class on due date
HW turned in late will be penalized with 50% of the maximum credit (no late submission will be accepted
after solutions are posted)

Violations of Honor Code:
Violations of honor code entail immediately a letter grade of F for the whole course and will be
automatically reported to university/college/department/program committee and supervising professor(s) for
further punishment. Violations of honor code include, but are not limited to, acts of copying, cheating,
colluding, disrupting of other studentsâ€™ learning, lying and misrepresenting facts.
